column4: On my current network I can do only limited internet stuff like pings and IRC but, no apt-gets or browsing. Any idea as to what would cause this?
Something must be blocking HTTP connections / port 80?
Thats what I thought but, wouldnt "ping google.com" use port 80 at least for the DNS lookup?
Nope, DNS uses a different port
udp 53 for DNS :)
does "apt-get" use port 80?
Yes, it uses standard HTTP connections on port 80, as far as I know
How do I test this? I suppose I need one more port 80 thing and another non-port 80 thing
Is this on a network at work or something?
In my win2k3 net admin class
college not HS
Ask the instructor?
It sounds like you might have to authenticate with some kind of proxy or something.
ATM it is lecture time but, during break a few min ago I told him
How would I confirm this?
Try this: wget http://www.google.com   then open the file that it saves - it should give you whatever the actual error code you're getting is, if you're getting something other than a timeout
it stops when it gets to "Connecting to www.google.com|Some sort of IP|:80..."
You probably have to be authenticated to the school's domain or something
I have used my laptop here many times with very few problems
Without authenticating at all?
IDK I would just click firefox and thats all
Should you be... you know... messing with win2k3 in your win2k3 class? lol
Yes, I would be but, I dont feel like triple booting my laptop so that means I need vmplayer
